title: Tender Eye of Round Roast Recipe
description: An eye of round roast is seasoned with a garlic rub, then roasted and served with a rich, flavorsome red wine pan sauce for a hearty meal.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Main Dishes Beef Tender Eye of Round Roast 4.4 (248) 215 Reviews 49 Photos Tasty, tender eye of round roast. Expand your culinary arsenal with this hearty, paleo-friendly meal. Submitted by Reynolds KitchensR Updated on November 19, 2024 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 49 49 49 49 Prep Time: 1 hr Cook Time: 1 hr 30 mins Total Time: 2 hrs 30 mins Servings: 12 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 12 servings 4 cloves garlic, minced 1 tablespoon olive oil 2 teaspoons kosher salt 1 teaspoon black pepper ½ teaspoon dried thyme 1 (3 pound) beef eye of round roast aluminum foil ½ cup dry red wine (merlot or cabernet sauvignon) ½ cup beef broth 2 tablespoons cold butter, cubed Directions Mix garlic, oil, salt, pepper, and thyme into a paste; rub all over beef roast. Set aside at room temperature for 1 hour. Forty minutes into the hour, preheat the oven to 500 degrees F (260 degrees C). Place two sheets of aluminum foil large enough to cover the beef roast on a baking sheet. Place beef roast on the foil sheets. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Roast in the preheated oven for 18 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Remove from the oven; fold up the foil so it wraps the roast then return it to the oven. Reduce oven temperature to 170 degrees F (75 degrees C) and roast for one hour. After an hour, check the internal temperature with an instant-read thermometer: 120-125 degrees F will yield a rare center, 130-140 degrees F will yield a medium-rare center, and 140-150 degrees F will yield a medium center. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Remove roast and set it on a cutting board to rest. Transfer any drippings from roast into a saucepan; stir in red wine and beef broth and bring to a simmer over medium-high heat until reduced by 1/4. Reduce heat to medium-low and whisk in cubes of butter, one at a time, until incorporated into sauce. Add salt and pepper to taste and set aside. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Slice the roast into 1/2-inch thick slices and serve with pan sauce poured on top. Editor's Note: This recipe is by Russ Crandall of The Domestic Man. I Made It Print 589 home cooks made it! Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Tender Eye of Round Roast 01 of 49 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 49 Photo by  SpeedyRind1041 03/31/2023 Great and easy recipe!Used meater+ thermometer to roast inside to perfectly 57°CIf your oven doesn't have a fan, 1h of 170F won't cook it. I increased the temperature to 350 after 1h and it took around 20 more minutes. 03 of 49 Photo by  SwiftTray1684 07/12/2022 The recipe works every time just the way it’s written. 04 of 49 Photo by  Pamela 06/14/2021 It turned out perfectly. I will make it this way again. 05 of 49 Photo by  rmpenate 05/24/2021 First time doing this recipe. Basic ingredients which makes it easy to prepare. Beef was tender (medium rare) and all the family enjoyed it. Definitely will be making this again! 06 of 49 Photo by  Jaye 05/23/2021 07 of 49 Photo by  Darcy Ripley Frame 02/28/2021 Easy and delicious. 08 of 49 Photo by  Harry 02/14/2021 very good flavor, very juicy and tasty. 09 of 49 Photo by  Harry 02/14/2021 very good flavor, very juicy and tasty. 10 of 49 Photo by  Harry 02/14/2021 very good flavor, very juicy and tasty. 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Classic Standing Beef Rib Roast 21 Ratings Easy Japanese Roast 1 Rating T-Bone Steaks With Red Wine Sauce 3 Ratings Mississippi Roast 41 Ratings Instant Pot Lamb Shoulder Chops 19 Ratings Braised Beef Cheeks 9 Ratings Cast-Iron Skillet Prime Rib Roast and Gravy 49 Ratings Prime Rib 217 Ratings Kim's Prime Rib 80 Ratings Paula's Dutch Oven Pot Roast 6 Ratings Simple Beef Short Ribs 328 Ratings Instant Pot Yankee Pot Roast 9 Ratings Apple Cider Pepper Pot Roast (Pressure Cooker Recipe) 2 Ratings Rock Salt Roast Prime Rib 29 Ratings Sweet and Sour Brisket 6 Ratings Smoked Standing Rib Roast 18 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family.
